Node.definition: = a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= state in which an object is firm and stable in shape
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= state in which objects are firm and unyielding to physical pressure; ◄ associated with a strong will
= large mythical monster living in the sea and looking like a giant croccodile or similar reptile

= long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching
= pertaining to the ability to move away quickly from dangerous location
= large mythical monster living in the sea and looking like a giant croccodile or similar reptile

= long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching
= action of moving forward in a wavy motion (said of snakes)
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= mythical sea monster, such as behemoth (בְּהֵמֹות) and leviathan (לִוְיָתָן)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them
= action by which humans produce musical sounds with their voice, often as a celebratory response, either set to a prescribed tune or spontaneous
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= a very short length of time
= process by which suffering comes upon humans or objects
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= causative action by which deities set fire to plants
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

Node.gloss: to hold on to|to devote oneself to|to persist in|to retain|to obtain
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities are actively involved in a certain event

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= process by which a plant produces flowers in the spring as a precursor to the plant's fruit; ≈ associated with strength, prosperity, and splendor

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: blow; hence: = action by which deities inflict punishment on people

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= the killing of people in a cruel and violent way
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

Node.gloss: to send away|to divorce|to expel|to remove|to cast out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans to go away from a certain location and/or position; ◄ due to a lack of affection, as punishment, or for other reasons
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
literally: hard; hence: = state in which the wind comes with such strength that it causes damage

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which deities do not hold wrongdoers any longer responsible for certain actions, often as a result of an atonement ritual or a change in behavior of the guilty party
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= a white soft earthy limestone, formed from the skeletal remains of sea creatures
= a pole, ◄ made of wood, ► representing the deity Ashera, and set up near the altar in a place of sacrifice
= construction with a flat top; ◄ probably made out of stone; ► used for burning incense; ≈ associated with non sanctioned worship

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an area has been made inaccessible and strong, beyond the reach of others, such as enemies, ◄ usually by surrounding it by a high wall
= the state of being apart from significant others
= action by which humans or deities stop caring for (other) humans or objects as if that person or object has been sent away from their presence
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= male young of a cow (פָּרָה) ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained
= action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack
literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause heavy damage to objects to the extent that they are almost gone
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= to put an object on fire

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans strike another object repeatedly + with a stick or a similar wooden instrument, ► so that items attached to this object will be released
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans blow air into a wind instrument and so produce a signal
= a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= action by which someone does not stay in a single expected location but moves about from place to place without a clear destination

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= person or animal that has been caused to leave their place or position by force

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
